children.comments: Creates a new buffer of the specified size.
children.title: create

children.comments: Creates an immutable copy of a mutable buffer.
children.title: freeze

children.comments:
O(1). Convert a mutable buffer to an immutable buffer, without copying. The
mutable buffer must not be mutated afterwards.
children.title: unsafeFreeze

children.comments: Creates a mutable copy of an immutable buffer.
children.title: thaw

children.comments:
O(1) Convert an immutable buffer to a mutable buffer, without copying. The
input buffer must not be used afterward.
children.title: unsafeThaw

children.comments: Creates a new buffer from an array of octets, sized to match the array.
children.title: fromArray

children.comments:
Creates a new buffer from a string with the specified encoding, sized to
match the string.
children.title: fromString

children.comments: Creates a buffer view from a JS ArrayByffer without copying data.
children.title: fromArrayBuffer

children.comments: Copies the data in the buffer to a new JS ArrayBuffer
children.title: toArrayBuffer

children.comments: Reads a numeric value from a buffer at the specified offset.
children.title: read

children.comments: Reads a section of a buffer as a string with the specified encoding.
children.title: readString

children.comments: Reads the buffer as a string with the specified encoding.
children.title: toString

children.comments: Writes a numeric value to a buffer at the specified offset.
children.title: write

children.comments:
Writes octets from a string to a buffer at the specified offset. Multi-byte
characters will not be written to the buffer if there is not enough capacity
to write them fully. The number of bytes written is returned.
children.title: writeString

children.comments: Creates an array of octets from a buffer's contents.
children.title: toArray

children.comments: Reads an octet from a buffer at the specified offset.
children.title: getAtOffset

children.comments: Writes an octet in the buffer at the specified offset.
children.title: setAtOffset

children.comments:
Creates a new buffer slice that acts like a window on the original buffer.
Writing to the slice buffer updates the original buffer and vice-versa.
children.title: slice

children.comments: Returns the size of a buffer.
children.title: size

children.comments: Concatenates a list of buffers.
children.title: concat

children.comments:
Concatenates a list of buffers, combining them into a new buffer of the
specified length.
children.title: concat'

children.comments:
Copies a section of a source buffer into a target buffer at the specified
offset, and returns the number of octets copied.
children.title: copy

children.comments: Fills a range in a buffer with the specified octet.
children.title: fill

declarations.comments:
A type class for mutable buffers `buf` where operations on those buffers are
represented by a particular monadic effect type `m`.
declarations.title: MutableBuffer

declarations.comments: Type synonym indicating the value refers to an offset in a buffer.
declarations.title: Offset

declarations.comments:
Type synonym indicating the value should be an octet (0-255). If the value
provided is outside this range it will be used as modulo 256.
declarations.title: Octet

declarations.comments: Enumeration of the numeric types that can be written to a buffer.
declarations.title: BufferValueType

declarations.comments: A reference to a mutable buffer for use with `Effect`
declarations.title: Buffer

declarations.comments:
A type class for mutable buffers `buf` where operations on those buffers are
represented by a particular monadic effect type `m`.
declarations.title: MutableBuffer

declarations.comments: An immutable buffer that exists independently of any memory region or effect.
declarations.title: ImmutableBuffer

declarations.comments: Creates a new buffer of the specified size.
declarations.title: create

declarations.comments: Creates a new buffer from an array of octets, sized to match the array.
declarations.title: fromArray

declarations.comments: Creates a new buffer from a string with the specified encoding, sized to match the string.
declarations.title: fromString

declarations.comments: Creates a buffer view from a JS ArrayByffer without copying data.
declarations.title: fromArrayBuffer

declarations.comments: Reads a numeric value from a buffer at the specified offset.
declarations.title: read

declarations.comments: Reads a section of a buffer as a string with the specified encoding.
declarations.title: readString

declarations.comments: Reads the buffer as a string with the specified encoding.
declarations.title: toString

declarations.comments: Creates an array of octets from a buffer's contents.
declarations.title: toArray

declarations.comments: Creates an `ArrayBuffer` by copying a buffer's contents.
declarations.title: toArrayBuffer

declarations.comments: Reads an octet from a buffer at the specified offset.
declarations.title: getAtOffset

declarations.comments: Concatenates a list of buffers.
declarations.title: concat

declarations.comments:
Concatenates a list of buffers, combining them into a new buffer of the
specified length.
declarations.title: concat'

declarations.comments: Creates a new buffer slice that shares the memory of the original buffer.
declarations.title: slice

declarations.comments: Returns the size of a buffer.
declarations.title: size

modules.name: Node.Buffer.Internal
modules.comments: Functions and types to support the other modules. Not for public use.

declarations.comments:
A reference to a mutable buffer for use with `ST`

The type parameter represents the memory region which the buffer belongs to.
declarations.title: STBuffer

declarations.comments:
Runs an effect creating an `STBuffer` then freezes the buffer and returns
it, without unneccessary copying.
declarations.title: run

declarations.comments:
Type synonym indicating the value should be an octet (0-255). If the value
provided is outside this range it will be used as modulo 256.
declarations.title: Octet

declarations.comments: Type synonym indicating the value refers to an offset in a buffer.
declarations.title: Offset

declarations.comments: Enumeration of the numeric types that can be written to a buffer.
declarations.title: BufferValueType

declarations.comments:
Convert an `Encoding` to a `String` in the format expected by Node.js
APIs.
declarations.title: encodingToNode
